com.sri.ai.grinder.theory.base

Class AbstractSingleVariableConstraintWithBinaryAtoms

  • java.lang.Object
    • com.sri.ai.grinder.core.AbstractExpression
      • com.sri.ai.expresso.helper.AbstractExpressionWrapper
        • com.sri.ai.grinder.core.constraint.AbstractConstraint
          • com.sri.ai.grinder.core.constraint.AbstractSingleVariableConstraint
            • com.sri.ai.grinder.core.constraint.AbstractSingleVariableConstraintWithDependentNormalizedAtoms
              • com.sri.ai.grinder.theory.base.AbstractSingleVariableConstraintWithBinaryAtoms
  • All Implemented Interfaces:
    Expression, Constraint, SingleVariableConstraint, java.io.Serializable, java.lang.Cloneable, java.lang.Comparable<java.lang.Object>
    Direct Known Subclasses:
    AbstractSingleVariableConstraintWithBinaryAtomsIncludingEquality

    @Beta
public abstract class AbstractSingleVariableConstraintWithBinaryAtoms
extends AbstractSingleVariableConstraintWithDependentNormalizedAtoms
    An abstract single-variable constraint solver providing functionality for theories involving only binary atoms. It assumes there are interaction among distinct normalized atoms.

    To maximize the detection of inconsistency, extensions can restrict the stored atoms to be applications of just a subset of the possible normal functors. For example, a difference arithmetic theory may choose to represent all normalized atoms as applications of =, <, and <=, converting atoms of !=, >, and >= as negations of normalized atoms.

    To achieve this, the extension must implement getNormalFunctors() to return a collection of the strings of the normal functors, and getNegationFunctor(String) to make a functor string to its negation functor's string.

    To ensure that only normalized atoms are stored in the constraint, the negation of a non-normal function must always be a normal functor. If the theory is such that it is not always possible to negate a non-normal functor to a normal one, then the extension must include all possible functors in getNormalFunctors().

    Extensions must also provide a way to flip functors with getFlipFunctor(String).

    Author:
    braz
    See Also:
    Serialized Form

    • Method Detail

      • fromNormalizedAtomToItsNegationAsLiteral

        public Expression fromNormalizedAtomToItsNegationAsLiteral(Expression normalizedAtom)
        Description copied from class: AbstractSingleVariableConstraint
        Returns the literal corresponding to the negation of the given normalized atom. Typically this will just return the application of NOT to the atom, but some languages may have more conventional (and more pleasing to read) ways of representing these negations (for example, not(X = a) -> X != a).
        Specified by:
        fromNormalizedAtomToItsNegationAsLiteral in class AbstractSingleVariableConstraint
        Returns:
